answers.answer: I measured big with my first daughter and she was 7lb 6oz my second daughter i measured perfect and she was eleven days early weighing 8lb 12oz don't stress.. how far along are you? if the baby is big it could be something like gestational diabetes. good luck keep us posted.:)
Sorry i read that you're 23 weeks sorry hang in there

i really dont know what that could mean but i wanted to wish you well on monday...im sure your little girl is ok...i think docs have to scare us at least once while we're preg...hang in there and keep us posted

were you measuring big at you 20 weeks ultrasound? if it is an all at once than it could be gestational diabetes, if you have gestational diabetes it can make the baby grow to big to fast and make you gain more weight! or the measurments could just be off this week depending on how the baby is sitting! good luck and hope things go good on monday! atleast you get another ultrasound!

I consistantly have measured 2 weeks ahead of schedule since my ultrasound at 20 weeks.  Uterus and baby, my baby has had his weight checked twice... once at 20 weeks and once at 24 weeks he has been double average.  Doc thinks he is just going to be a big baby.  My husband is 6'3 and weighs 250 pounds he weighed almost 11 pounds at birth.  Docs say he is just going to be like his daddy.  I had my gestational diabetes test and I passed perfectly my husbands mom didn't have diabetes either all of her kids were big.  He will have a weight check again at 32 weeks if he it looks like he is going to be more than 9 pounds they will schedule a c-section.  Maybe that is what is going on with you?
I was measuring 4 weeks ahead at my 20 week and my Dr. wasn't concerned at all. towards the end I started to measure right on track

The only possibility I can think of would be that either yoru dates are off, or that you may have too much amniotic fluid. I don't know, but I wish you well on Monday, let us know how it goes. It may also depend on how your uterus is sitting, that can have an affect on the measurement as well.

He didn't tell me what I was measuring just that I was measuring big. He asked me "don't u think ur big?" of course I do but most pregnant women think there big.I really hope it's not GD!! More amniotic fluid would be better. I'm a little calmer now but still concerned. She is very active so I know she's ok in there.I have a retroverted uterus. Not sure how that would effect the position at 23wks.

I had the same prob. I looked like I was carrying twins. I was always a few weeks ahead of what I should have measured. I gained about 60lbs my entire pregnancy. I was without health care most of my pregnancy, but the hospitals helped me out when they could because no docs would accept me cuz I was too far along when I finally moved back to Texas from Massachusetts. My daughter ended up coming out 10lbs 13oz. I was suspected GD. I sweated most of my weight off within the first month PP.You'll be having your gluecose test probably next month. But if you notice any abnormal swelling, particularly in your hands, feet and legs, don't be surprised if the doc wants to do some tests. You could also just end up having a really big baby and that's why you're gaining weight. Big babies run in my family so I never expected anything less than the 2 porkers I got. hehe.

well last week i measured 3 weeks ahead of time even on my ultra sound so dont worry she probably is just big or just a little more fluid which is fine from what i hear.. and im only a week behind you so i think its ok...

I was also gained weight at such a rapid pace, I was later diagnosed with (borderline) preeclampsia..... I was just awfully swollen starting from month5 and up..... It cud just be swelling.... DO not eat anything salty, and drink tons and tons of water.... NO JUICE NO SODAs. ..... those just put on unwanted weight.
I'm trying to not worry about this but since I've left the Dr office yesterday I've been depressed. I just don't want to do anything I have no energy.
He may want you to come in for the GD test. I'm due the same day as you and my OB is having me do the GD test Monday morning. I wouldn't worry too much. Let us know Joe it goes.

im sorry you're depressed....docs are good at scaring the crap out of us sometimes...the hardest part is getting to the next appt...im sure everything is going to be fine and its good that your doc is watching you closely....i hope you are able to try and enjoy your weekend and ill be looking for your "all clear" post on mondayhappy mothers day :)

Hopefully the weekend will go by fast! Work was slow but I started feeling better having something to keep my mind busy.Monday 1pm can't come soon enough.Thanks ladies you've all been so reasuring and helped ease my worries.

question: I just got out of my monthly check up. I'm 23wks today and it's the first time he's measured me. The nurse measured me and then the Dr remeasured so I thought that was weird. He then told me he wants me to come in on Monday next avalable apointment for an ultrasound I'm measuring to big and I gained 9lbs in 4wks.He didn't mention what could be the reason for the large weight gain and large uterus. I'm freaking out.I have had a very normal easy pregnancy so far. Been measuring just a day or two ahead on all the early ultrasounds. I had one a week from 6-12wks.Please reasure me there isn't anything to stress out about.
title: Measuring to big high weight gain
